designations.source: A review of the millipedes (Diplopoda), centipedes (Chilopoda) and woodlice (Isopoda) of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national threat status of millipedes, centipedes and woodlice. It covers all millipedes, centipedes and woodlice, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non threatened and non-native species. Paul Lee. November 2015.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.
designations.comments: Probably under recorded (Barber, 2009) due to the difficulty of locating centipedes in intertidal rock crevices but known from only 6 hectads since 1990.
